text:
I just delayed a production send this morning by an hour because I got this warning in the “Review and schedule” screen when I was trying to finish up.

> _Your email is over 102KB. As Gmail clips emails over this size, the calculation of your open rate metrics will be affected. If you want to reduce the size, you can preview your email here to see where it will be clipped._
Ok. Great. I _really_ doubt that, but I guess I have to stop and check that. So I cloned my email and then sent a full production send to just one recipient, myself. A few minute later it lands in my inbox at Gmail. No clipping found. I download the message and open it in <http://Parcel.io|Parcel.io>. Just 70kb. Wayyyy below the 102KB limit.

So it’s great to know that HubSpot’s clipping warning is wildly and completely unreliable.

:man-facepalming:

I should also note that…

> you can preview your email here to see where it will be clipped
Was completely broken. It was just my email with a bunch of visible code (that wasn’t mine) injected into the body in all sorts of locations. It didn’t show me what it said it would show me.
